intro: Thibaudia leucostoma, commonly known as the white-stemmed thibaudia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically ovate or lance-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Thibaudia leucostoma is often found in moist, shady environments such as forest understories and stream banks.
